summary: This document is an email correspondence between Jeffrey Epstein and Jes Staley discussing negative press coverage and a claim regarding the FBI reopening an investigation. Epstein mentions that a phonebook was stolen by his houseman, who is currently in prison. The email emphasizes confidentiality and attorney-client privilege.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is discussing negative press and claims about an FBI investigation in this email correspondence.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is receiving communication from Epstein regarding press coverage and is mentioned as the recipient of the email.

connections.description: Epstein is communicating with Staley, indicating a relationship that may involve legal counsel.

keyFacts: Epstein claims that the FBI is not reopening an investigation, contrary to media reports.
A phonebook was stolen by Epstein's houseman, who is currently imprisoned.
The email emphasizes confidentiality and may contain attorney-client privileged information.
